text.text_translated:
Girox Foods has about 12% of employees who leave each year.  
The normal number for the industry is 7%.  
This report looks for reasons why employees leave.  
It also looks at why employees feel connected to work.  
The goal is to make the employee experience better.  
It will give advice to make the experience better.  
It will help keep more employees.

feedback.feedback:
FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8762 is below the required 0.90 threshold. This indicates a significant loss of key phrasing from the original text. Key terms like 'employee turnover' and 'investigate the causes' were replaced with overly simple phrases, losing necessary lexical detail.

- CEFR Compliance Failure: The text was classified as B1, not the required A2. This is a direct violation of the core requirement.
- Grammatical Complexity: The sentence 'Girox Foods has about 12% of employees who leave each year' uses a relative clause ('who leave...'), which is a B1 structure.
- Grammatical Complexity: The sentences 'This report looks for reasons why employees leave' and 'It also looks at why employees feel connected to work' use subordinate wh-clauses. These are B1 structures and are too complex for the A2 level.

Suggestion: Eliminate all complex clauses. Rephrase sentences to adhere to a simple Subject-Verb-Object structure. Example: 'About 12% of employees leave Girox Foods each year.' Split the 'why' clauses into separate, simple questions or statements.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Girox Foods loses about 12 % of its workers each year.  
The usual rate in the industry is about 7 %.  
This report will find why workers feel connected to their jobs.  
We will study how employees feel about the company.  
We will give advice to improve the employee experience.  
The employee experience is how workers feel at work.  
We will try to keep workers longer.
